mods.abstract: A Runaway in Jail. Was committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 26th February last, a runaway griffe calling himself Charles, and saying he belongs to certain High Carline, residing near Cheneyville, on Bayou BÅ“uf. Charles is a griffe, about 22 years old, 5 feet 8 inches high, spare made, and speaking English only. The owner of said slave is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas March 3rd 1853
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
